div.l: Of his dispence · in place of privite
That fond his maister wele · in his chaffare
For often tyme · he fond his box bare
For sikerly · a prentice Reuelour
That hauntith dise Riot and ꝑparamour
His maister shal it · in his shoppe abie
Al have he no part of the mynstralsye
For theft and Riot · they bien conủertible
Al kan he pley · on gyterne and Ribible
Revel and trowth · as in alowe degre
They bien ful wroth · al day men may soe
This Ioly prentice · with his maister bode
Til he were nygh oute of his prentishode
Al were he snybbed · both erly and late
And somtyme lad with Revel to newgate
But at last his maister hym bethought
Vpon aday · whan he his papir sought
Of a prouerbe · that seith this same word
Wel better is Roten Appul · out of hoord
Than it Rote · al the Remenᵃaunt
So farith it bi a Riotous ʆseruᵃaunt
It is ful lasse harm · to leten hym passe
Than he shend al the ʆseruauntis in the place
Thorfor his maister · gaf hym acquitaunce
And bad hym goo with sorow · and with myschaunce
And thus this Ioly prentice had his leve
Now late hym Riot · al nyght or leve
And for ther nys no thief · without a lowke
